enWisdom: Knowledge saves you, ignorance destroys you
Knowledge is the most sublime provision
Knowledge is the most excellent [or honourable] guidance
Knowledge is the most excellent guidance
Knowledge is the most honourable guidance

Wisdom: الْعِلْمُ يُرْشِدُكَ إِلَى مَا أَمَرَكَ اللَّهُ بِهِ وَالزُّهْدُ يُسَهِّلُ لَكَ الطَّرِيقَ إِلَيْهِ
enWisdom: Knowledge guides you towards that which Allah has commanded you to do and renunciation of worldly pleasures makes the path to it easier for you

Wisdom: الْعِلْمُ أَوَّلُ دَلِيلٍ وَالْمَعْرِفَةُ آخِرُ نِهَايَةٍ
enWisdom: Knowledge is the first guide and cognizance is the final end
Seek knowledge and you will be rightly guided

Wisdom: إِنَّ الْعِلْمَ يَهْدِي وَيُرْشِدُ وَيُنْجِي وَإِنَّ الْجَهْلَ يُغْوِي وَيُضِلُّ وَيُرْدِي

enWisdom: The wealth of knowledge saves and preserves

Wisdom: فِكْرُكَ يَهْدِيكَ إِلَى الرَّشَادِ وَيَحْدُوكَ عَلَى إِصْلَاحِ الْمَعَادِ
enWisdom: Your contemplation guides you to the right path and motivates you to improve your Hereafter

Wisdom: كَمَا إِنَّ الْعِلْمَ يَهْدِي الْمَرْءَ وَيُنْجِيهِ كَذَلِكَ الْجَهْلُ يُضِلُّهُ وَيُرْدِيهِ
enWisdom: Just as knowledge guides a person and saves him, similarly, ignorance misguides him and destroys him
One who gains knowledge (or acts [upon his knowledge]) is rightly guided
One who is alone with knowledge does not feel frightened by [his] loneliness
One who is alone with knowledge does not feel frightened by [his] loneliness

Wisdom: مَنْ لَمْ يَهْدِهِ الْعِلْمُ أَضَلَّهُ الْجَهْلُ
enWisdom: One who acts with knowledge attains his goal and desire from the Hereafter
Do not make enmity with that which you are ignorant of, for indeed most of knowledge is in that which you don’t know

Wisdom: لَا هِدَايَةَ لِمَنْ لَا عِلْمَ لَهُ
enWisdom: There is no guidance for one who has no knowledge
